stmt: Every prime number is `2` or odd.
prompts:
[{"theorem": "∀ {m n : ℕ}, Odd n → m ∣ n → m ≠ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "`2` is not a factor of an odd natural number. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {p : ℕ} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], p % 2 = 1 ↔ p ≠ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A prime `p` satisfies `p % 2 = 1` if and only if `p ≠ 2`. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {p : ℕ} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], p ≠ 2 → (IsSquare 2 ↔ p % 8 = 1 ∨ p % 8 = 7)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "`2` is a square modulo an odd prime `p` iff `p` is congruent to `1` or `7` mod `8`. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ (n : ℕ), Nat.factorization n = 0 ↔ n = 0 ∨ n = 1",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The only numbers with empty prime factorization are `0` and `1` "},
 {"theorem": "Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ≠ 0}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [dec_irr : (p : Associates α) → Decidable (Irreducible p)]\n  [inst_1 : UniqueFactorizationMonoid α] [dec : DecidableEq α] [dec' : DecidableEq (Associates α)] {a p : Associates α},\n  Irreducible p →\n    ∀ [inst_2 : (n : ℕ) → Decidable (a ∣ p ^ n)] {n : ℕ} (h : a ∣ p ^ n),\n      a = p ^ Nat.find (_ : ∃ n, (fun n => a ∣ p ^ n) n)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The only divisors of prime powers are prime powers. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ (p : ℕ) [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], Prime ↑p ↔ p % 4 = 3",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A prime natural number is prime in `ℤ[i]` if and only if it is `3` mod `4` "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {p : ℕ} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], p ≠ 2 → (IsSquare (-2) ↔ p % 8 = 1 ∨ p % 8 = 3)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "`-2` is a square modulo an odd prime `p` iff `p` is congruent to `1` or `3` mod `8`. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {p q : ℕ}, Nat.Prime p → ↑(Nat.factorization p) q ≠ 0 → p = q",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The only prime factor of prime `p` is `p` itself. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {F : Type u_1} [inst : Field F] [inst_1 : Finite F], ringChar F = 2 → ∀ (a : F), IsSquare a",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a finite field of characteristic `2`, all elements are squares. "}]

stmt: There are infinitely many odd natural numbers.
prompts:
[{"theorem": "Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ≠ 0}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {ι : Type u_2} {M : Type u_1} [inst : AddCommMonoid M] {s : Finset ι} {f : ι → WithTop M},\n  (Finset.sum s fun i => f i) = ⊤ ↔ ∃ i, i ∈ s ∧ f i = ⊤",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A sum of numbers is infinite iff one of them is infinite "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {n : ℕ}, n ≠ 0 → ∀ (d : ℕ), ∃ᶠ (m : ℕ) in Filter.atTop, m ≡ d [MOD n]",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Infinitely many natural numbers are equal to `d` mod `n`. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {n : ℕ}, n % 2 = 1 ↔ n % 4 = 1 ∨ n % 4 = 3",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A natural number is odd iff it has residue `1` or `3` mod `4`"},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} {s : Finset α} {f : α → ENNReal}, (∀ (a : α), a ∈ s → f a ≠ ⊤) → (Finset.sum s fun a => f a) < ⊤",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A sum of finite numbers is still finite "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {ι : Type u_2} {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommMonoidWithZero R] [inst_1 : NoZeroDivisors R] [inst_2 : Nontrivial R]\n  [inst_3 : DecidableEq R] [inst_4 : LT R] {s : Finset ι} {f : ι → WithTop R},\n  (∀ (i : ι), i ∈ s → f i ≠ ⊤) → (Finset.prod s fun i => f i) < ⊤",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A product of finite numbers is still finite "},
 {"theorem":
  "Set.Unbounded (fun x x_1 => x < x_1) {b | Cardinal.ord (Ordinal.card b) = b ∧ Ordinal.omega ≤ b}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Infinite ordinals that are cardinals are unbounded. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u_1} [inst : LinearOrderedField K] [inst_1 : FloorRing K] (v : K) (n : ℕ),\n  ∃ q, GeneralizedContinuedFraction.convergents (GeneralizedContinuedFraction.of v) n = ↑q",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Every finite convergent corresponds to a rational number. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {r : ℝ}, Transcendental ℚ r → Irrational r",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A transcendental real number is irrational. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : PseudoMetricSpace α] {u : ℕ → α}, CauchySeq u → ∃ R, R > 0 ∧ ∀ (m n : ℕ), dist (u m) (u n) < R",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A Cauchy sequence on the natural numbers is bounded. "}]

stmt: The smallest odd prime is `3`.

[{"theorem": "∀ (p : ℕ) [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], Prime ↑p ↔ p % 4 = 3",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A prime natural number is prime in `ℤ[i]` if and only if it is `3` mod `4` "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {n : ℕ}, n % 2 = 1 ↔ n % 4 = 1 ∨ n % 4 = 3",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A natural number is odd iff it has residue `1` or `3` mod `4`"},
 {"theorem": "∀ (n : ℕ), Nat.factorization n = 0 ↔ n = 0 ∨ n = 1",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The only numbers with empty prime factorization are `0` and `1` "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {p : ℕ} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], p ≠ 2 → (IsSquare (-2) ↔ p % 8 = 1 ∨ p % 8 = 3)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "`-2` is a square modulo an odd prime `p` iff `p` is congruent to `1` or `3` mod `8`. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {p : ℕ} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], p % 2 = 1 ↔ p ≠ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A prime `p` satisfies `p % 2 = 1` if and only if `p ≠ 2`. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {p : ℕ} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], p ≠ 2 → (IsSquare 2 ↔ p % 8 = 1 ∨ p % 8 = 7)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "`2` is a square modulo an odd prime `p` iff `p` is congruent to `1` or `7` mod `8`. "},
 {"theorem": "Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ≠ 0}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {A : Type u_1} {B : Type u_2} [inst : Field A] [inst_1 : Ring B] [inst_2 : IsDomain B] [inst_3 : Algebra A B] {x : B},\n  IsIntegral A x → Prime (minpoly A x)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A minimal polynomial is prime. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {n : ℕ}, 0 < n → ¬Nat.Prime n → Nat.minFac n ^ 2 ≤ n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The square of the smallest prime factor of a composite number `n` is at most `n`.\n"},

  "isProp": true,

stmt: There are infinitely many odd prime numbers.
prompts:
[{"theorem": "Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ≠ 0}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [dec_irr : (p : Associates α) → Decidable (Irreducible p)]\n  [inst_1 : UniqueFactorizationMonoid α] [dec : DecidableEq α] [dec' : DecidableEq (Associates α)] {a p : Associates α},\n  Irreducible p →\n    ∀ [inst_2 : (n : ℕ) → Decidable (a ∣ p ^ n)] {n : ℕ} (h : a ∣ p ^ n),\n      a = p ^ Nat.find (_ : ∃ n, (fun n => a ∣ p ^ n) n)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The only divisors of prime powers are prime powers. "},

  "∀ {k : ℕ}, k ≠ 0 → Set.Infinite {p | Nat.Prime p ∧ p ≡ 1 [MOD k]}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "For any positive `k : ℕ` there are infinitely many primes `p` such that `p ≡ 1 [MOD k]`. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ (n : ℕ), ∃ p, n ≤ p ∧ Nat.Prime p",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Euclid's theorem on the **infinitude of primes**.\nHere given in the form: for every `n`, there exists a prime number `p ≥ n`. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ (n : ℕ), Nat.factorization n = 0 ↔ n = 0 ∨ n = 1",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The only numbers with empty prime factorization are `0` and `1` "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ (R : Type u) [inst : Semiring R] (q : ℕ) [hq : ExpChar R q], Nat.Prime q ∨ q = 1",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The exponential characteristic is a prime number or one. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {ι : Type u_2} {M : Type u_1} [inst : AddCommMonoid M] {s : Finset ι} {f : ι → WithTop M},\n  (Finset.sum s fun i => f i) = ⊤ ↔ ∃ i, i ∈ s ∧ f i = ⊤",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A sum of numbers is infinite iff one of them is infinite "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : Fintype α] [inst_1 : Field α], IsPrimePow (Fintype.card α)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A finite field has prime power cardinality. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Group α] [inst_1 : Fintype α] {p : ℕ} [hp : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], Fintype.card α = p → IsCyclic α",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A finite group of prime order is cyclic. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {ι : Type u_2} {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommMonoidWithZero R] [inst_1 : NoZeroDivisors R] [inst_2 : Nontrivial R]\n  [inst_3 : DecidableEq R] [inst_4 : LT R] {s : Finset ι} {f : ι → WithTop R},\n  (∀ (i : ι), i ∈ s → f i ≠ ⊤) → (Finset.prod s fun i => f i) < ⊤",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A product of finite numbers is still finite "}]

stmt: If a vector space has dimension `2` then it is finite dimensional.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V] {ι : Type w}\n  [inst_3 : Finite ι], Basis ι K V → FiniteDimensional K V",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a vector space has a finite basis, then it is finite-dimensional. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V] {ι : Type w}\n  {s : Set ι}, Basis (↑s) K V → Set.Finite s → FiniteDimensional K V",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a vector space has a basis indexed by elements of a finite set, then it is\nfinite-dimensional. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {R : Type u} [inst : Ring R] [inst_1 : StrongRankCondition R] {M : Type v} [inst_2 : AddCommGroup M]\n  [inst_3 : Module R M] {ι : Type w} [inst_4 : Fintype ι], Basis ι R M → Module.rank R M = ↑(Fintype.card ι)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a vector space has a finite basis, then its dimension (seen as a cardinal) is equal to the\ncardinality of the basis. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V],\n  Module.rank K V < Cardinal.aleph0 → Set.Finite (Basis.ofVectorSpaceIndex K V)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a vector space has a finite dimension, the index set of `Basis.ofVectorSpace` is finite. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {𝕜 : Type u} [inst : NontriviallyNormedField 𝕜] {E : Type v} [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E]\n  [inst_2 : NormedSpace 𝕜 E] [inst_3 : CompleteSpace 𝕜] (s : Submodule 𝕜 E)\n  [inst_4 : FiniteDimensional 𝕜 { x // x ∈ s }], IsClosed ↑s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A finite-dimensional subspace is closed. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ (k : Type u_2) {V : Type u_3} {P : Type u_1} [inst : DivisionRing k] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module k V]\n  [inst_3 : AddTorsor V P] {s : Set P}, Set.Finite s → FiniteDimensional k { x // x ∈ vectorSpan k s }",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The `vectorSpan` of a finite set is finite-dimensional. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V]\n  [inst_3 : FiniteDimensional K V] (S : Submodule K V), FiniteDimensional K { x // x ∈ S }",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A subspace of a finite-dimensional space is also finite-dimensional. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : Ring K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V]\n  [inst_3 : StrongRankCondition K] {ι : Type w} [inst_4 : Fintype ι],\n  Basis ι K V → FiniteDimensional.finrank K V = Fintype.card ι",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a vector space (or module) has a finite basis, then its dimension (or rank) is equal to the\ncardinality of the basis. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {𝕜 : Type u} [inst : NontriviallyNormedField 𝕜] {E : Type v} [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E]\n  [inst_2 : NormedSpace 𝕜 E] [inst_3 : CompleteSpace 𝕜] (s : Submodule 𝕜 E)\n  [inst_4 : FiniteDimensional 𝕜 { x // x ∈ s }], IsComplete ↑s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A finite-dimensional subspace is complete. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V],\n  Module.rank K V ≤ 1 ↔ ∃ v₀, ∀ (v : V), ∃ r, r • v₀ = v",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A vector space has dimension at most `1` if and only if there is a\nsingle vector of which all vectors are multiples. "}]

stmt: Every field is a division ring.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u_1} [inst : DivisionRing K] {Γ₀ : Type u_2} [inst_1 : LinearOrderedCommGroupWithZero Γ₀]\n  [inst_2 : Valued K Γ₀], SeparatedSpace K",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A valued division ring is separated. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ (K : Type u) [inst : Field K], ValuationRing K",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A field is a valuation ring. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u_2} {L : Type u_1} [inst : Field K] [inst_1 : Field L] [inst_2 : Algebra K L] (S : IntermediateField K L),\n  1 ∈ S",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "An intermediate field contains the ring's 1. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u_2} {L : Type u_1} [inst : Field K] [inst_1 : Field L] [inst_2 : Algebra K L] (S : IntermediateField K L),\n  0 ∈ S",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "An intermediate field contains the ring's 0. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u_2} {L : Type u_1} [inst : Field K] [inst_1 : Field L] [inst_2 : Algebra K L] (S : IntermediateField K L)\n  {x y : L}, x ∈ S → y ∈ S → x / y ∈ S",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "An intermediate field is closed under division. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : LinearOrderedSemifield α] [inst_1 : FloorSemiring α] (m n : ℕ), ⌊↑m / ↑n⌋₊ = m / n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Natural division is the floor of field division. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : NormedDivisionRing α], TopologicalDivisionRing α",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A normed division ring is a topological division ring. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u} [inst : DivisionSemiring K] (I : Ideal K), I = ⊥ ∨ I = ⊤",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "All ideals in a division (semi)ring are trivial. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {R : Type u} [inst : Semiring R], IsField R → ∃ x y, x ≠ y",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "For a semiring to be a field, it must have two distinct elements. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u} [inst : Field K] (s : Subfield K) {x y : K}, x ∈ s → y ∈ s → x / y ∈ s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A subfield is closed under division. "}]

stmt: If a space has dimension `2` then it is finite dimensional.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V] {ι : Type w}\n  [inst_3 : Finite ι], Basis ι K V → FiniteDimensional K V",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a vector space has a finite basis, then it is finite-dimensional. "},

  "∀ {k G : Type u} [inst : Field k] [inst_1 : Monoid G] (V W : FdRep k G), FiniteDimensional k (V ⟶ W)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "All hom spaces are finite dimensional. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {𝕜 : Type u} [inst : NontriviallyNormedField 𝕜] {E : Type v} [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E]\n  [inst_2 : NormedSpace 𝕜 E] [inst_3 : CompleteSpace 𝕜] (s : Submodule 𝕜 E)\n  [inst_4 : FiniteDimensional 𝕜 { x // x ∈ s }], IsClosed ↑s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A finite-dimensional subspace is closed. "},

  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A subspace of a finite-dimensional space is also finite-dimensional. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V]\n  [inst_3 : FiniteDimensional K V] (S : Submodule K V), FiniteDimensional K (V ⧸ S)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "A quotient of a finite-dimensional space is also finite-dimensional. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {M : Type u_2} [inst : AddCommGroup M] {𝕜 : Type u_1} [inst_1 : Field 𝕜] [inst_2 : Module 𝕜 M] (f : M →ₗ[𝕜] M),\n  ↑LinearMap.det f ≠ 1 → FiniteDimensional 𝕜 M",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a linear map has determinant different from `1`, then the space is finite-dimensional. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_1 : CompactSpace α] [inst : DiscreteTopology α], Finite α",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A compact discrete space is finite. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {𝕜 : Type u} [inst : NontriviallyNormedField 𝕜] {E : Type v} [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E]\n  [inst_2 : NormedSpace 𝕜 E] [inst_3 : CompleteSpace 𝕜] (s : Submodule 𝕜 E)\n  [inst_4 : FiniteDimensional 𝕜 { x // x ∈ s }], IsComplete ↑s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A finite-dimensional subspace is complete. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {𝕜 : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} {F : Type u_3} [inst : Field 𝕜] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace 𝕜] [inst_2 : AddCommGroup E]\n  [inst_3 : Module 𝕜 E] [inst_4 : TopologicalSpace E] [inst_5 : AddCommGroup F] [inst_6 : Module 𝕜 F]\n  [inst_7 : TopologicalSpace F] [inst_8 : TopologicalAddGroup F] [inst_9 : ContinuousSMul 𝕜 F]\n  [inst_10 : FiniteDimensional 𝕜 E] [inst_11 : FiniteDimensional 𝕜 F], FiniteDimensional 𝕜 (E →L[𝕜] F)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The space of continuous linear maps between finite-dimensional spaces is finite-dimensional. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u} {V : Type v} [inst : DivisionRing K] [inst_1 : AddCommGroup V] [inst_2 : Module K V] {ι : Type w}\n  {s : Set ι}, Basis (↑s) K V → Set.Finite s → FiniteDimensional K V",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a vector space has a basis indexed by elements of a finite set, then it is\nfinite-dimensional. "}]

stmt: Every natural number has a successor.
prompts:
[{"theorem": "Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ≠ 0}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {K : Type u_1} [inst : LinearOrderedField K] [inst_1 : FloorRing K] (v : K) (n : ℕ),\n  ∃ q, GeneralizedContinuedFraction.convergents (GeneralizedContinuedFraction.of v) n = ↑q",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Every finite convergent corresponds to a rational number. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {m n : ℕ}, (∀ (a : ℕ), m ∣ a ↔ n ∣ a) ↔ m = n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same multiples. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ (a : Ordinal.{u}), ∃ f, Ordinal.IsFundamentalSequence a (Cardinal.ord (Ordinal.cof a)) f",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Every ordinal has a fundamental sequence. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {m n : ℕ}, (∀ (a : ℕ), a ∣ m ↔ a ∣ n) ↔ m = n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same divisors. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : PseudoMetricSpace α] {u : ℕ → α}, CauchySeq u → ∃ R, R > 0 ∧ ∀ (m n : ℕ), dist (u m) (u n) < R",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "A Cauchy sequence on the natural numbers is bounded. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : LinearOrderedRing α] [inst_1 : Archimedean α] {x y : α},\n  1 ≤ x → 1 < y → ∃ n, y ^ n ≤ x ∧ x < y ^ (n + 1)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every x greater than or equal to 1 is between two successive\nnatural-number powers of every y greater than one. "},
 {"theorem":

stmt: Every set is Lebesgue measurable.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "∀ {G : Type w} [inst : TopologicalSpace G] (μ : MeasureTheory.Content G) [inst_1 : T2Space G] [S : MeasurableSpace G]\n  [inst_2 : BorelSpace G], S ≤ MeasureTheory.OuterMeasure.caratheodory (MeasureTheory.Content.outerMeasure μ)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "For the outer measure coming from a content, all Borel sets are measurable. "},
 {"theorem": "↑↑MeasureTheory.volume {x | Liouville x} = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The set of Liouville numbers has Lebesgue measure zero. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : MeasurableSpace α] (μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α) (s : Set α),\n  ∃ t, s ⊆ t ∧ MeasurableSet t ∧ ↑↑μ t = ↑↑μ s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "For every set there exists a measurable superset of the same measure. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_1 : MeasurableSpace α] [inst_2 : BorelSpace α],\n  OpensMeasurableSpace α",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "In a `BorelSpace` all open sets are measurable. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_1 : MeasurableSpace α] [inst_2 : BorelSpace α]\n  [inst_3 : LinearOrder α] [inst_4 : OrderTopology α] [inst_5 : TopologicalSpace.SecondCountableTopology α] {s : Set α},\n  (∀ (x : α), x ∈ s → s ∈ nhdsWithin x (Set.Ioi x)) → MeasurableSet s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a set is a right-neighborhood of all of its points, then it is measurable. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : MeasurableSpace α] {f : α → ℝ}, Measurable f → MeasurableSet {p | p.snd = f p.fst}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The graph of a measurable function is a measurable set. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {ι : Type u_2} {γ : Type u_1} [tγ : TopologicalSpace γ] [inst : PolishSpace γ] [inst : MeasurableSpace γ]\n  {β : Type u_3} [inst_1 : MeasurableSpace β] [hγ : OpensMeasurableSpace γ] [inst_2 : Countable ι] {l : Filter ι}\n  [inst_3 : Filter.IsCountablyGenerated l] {f : ι → β → γ},\n  (∀ (i : ι), Measurable (f i)) → MeasurableSet {x | ∃ c, Filter.Tendsto (fun n => f n x) l (nhds c)}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The set of points for which a measurable sequence of functions converges is measurable. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ (𝕜 : Type u_2) [inst : NontriviallyNormedField 𝕜] {E : Type u_1} [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E]\n  [inst_2 : NormedSpace 𝕜 E] {F : Type u_3} [inst_3 : NormedAddCommGroup F] [inst_4 : NormedSpace 𝕜 F] (f : E → F)\n  [inst_5 : MeasurableSpace E] [inst_6 : OpensMeasurableSpace E] [inst_7 : CompleteSpace F],\n  MeasurableSet {x | DifferentiableAt 𝕜 f x}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The set of differentiability points of a function taking values in a complete space is\nBorel-measurable. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {F : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup F] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℝ F] (f : ℝ → F) [inst_2 : CompleteSpace F],\n  MeasurableSet {x | DifferentiableWithinAt ℝ f (Set.Ici x) x}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The set of right differentiability points of a function taking values in a complete space is\nBorel-measurable. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ (𝕜 : Type u_3) [inst : NontriviallyNormedField 𝕜] {E : Type u_2} [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E]\n  [inst_2 : NormedSpace 𝕜 E] {F : Type u_1} [inst_3 : NormedAddCommGroup F] [inst_4 : NormedSpace 𝕜 F] (f : E → F)\n  [inst_5 : MeasurableSpace E] [inst_6 : OpensMeasurableSpace E] {K : Set (E →L[𝕜] F)},\n  IsComplete K → MeasurableSet {x | DifferentiableAt 𝕜 f x ∧ fderiv 𝕜 f x ∈ K}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The set of differentiability points of a function, with derivative in a given complete set,\nis Borel-measurable. "}]

stmt: Every set of Borel measure zero is Lebesgue measurable.
prompts:
[{"theorem": "↑↑MeasureTheory.volume {x | Liouville x} = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The set of Liouville numbers has Lebesgue measure zero. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {G : Type w} [inst : TopologicalSpace G] (μ : MeasureTheory.Content G) [inst_1 : T2Space G] [S : MeasurableSpace G]\n  [inst_2 : BorelSpace G], S ≤ MeasureTheory.OuterMeasure.caratheodory (MeasureTheory.Content.outerMeasure μ)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "For the outer measure coming from a content, all Borel sets are measurable. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : MeasurableSpace G] [inst_1 : Group G] [inst_2 : MeasurableMul₂ G]\n  (μ ν : MeasureTheory.Measure G) [inst_3 : MeasureTheory.SigmaFinite ν] [inst_4 : MeasureTheory.SigmaFinite μ]\n  {s : Set G} [inst_5 : MeasurableInv G] [inst_6 : MeasureTheory.Measure.IsMulLeftInvariant μ]\n  [inst_7 : MeasureTheory.Measure.IsMulLeftInvariant ν],\n  MeasurableSet s → ↑↑ν s ≠ 0 → ↑↑ν s ≠ ⊤ → μ = (↑↑μ s / ↑↑ν s) • ν",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Left invariant Borel measures on a measurable group are unique (up to a scalar). "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {E : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℝ E] [inst_2 : MeasurableSpace E]\n  [inst_3 : BorelSpace E] [inst_4 : FiniteDimensional ℝ E] (μ : MeasureTheory.Measure E)\n  [inst_5 : MeasureTheory.Measure.IsAddHaarMeasure μ] {s : Set E} (u : ℕ → E),\n  Metric.Bounded (Set.range u) → Pairwise (Disjoint on fun n => {u n} + s) → MeasurableSet s → ↑↑μ s = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a set is disjoint of its translates by infinitely many bounded vectors, then it has measure\nzero. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_1 : MeasurableSpace α] [inst_2 : BorelSpace α],\n  OpensMeasurableSpace α",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "In a `BorelSpace` all open sets are measurable. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace.SecondCountableTopology α]\n  (m : MeasureTheory.OuterMeasure α) (s : Set α), (∀ (x : α), x ∈ s → ∃ u, u ∈ nhdsWithin x s ∧ ↑m u = 0) → ↑m s = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a set has zero measure in a neighborhood of each of its points, then it has zero measure\nin a second-countable space. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {G : Type u_1} [inst : MeasurableSpace G] [inst_1 : AddGroup G] [inst_2 : MeasurableAdd₂ G]\n  (μ ν : MeasureTheory.Measure G) [inst_3 : MeasureTheory.SigmaFinite ν] [inst_4 : MeasureTheory.SigmaFinite μ]\n  {s : Set G} [inst_5 : MeasurableNeg G] [inst_6 : MeasureTheory.Measure.IsAddLeftInvariant μ]\n  [inst_7 : MeasureTheory.Measure.IsAddLeftInvariant ν],\n  MeasurableSet s → ↑↑ν s ≠ 0 → ↑↑ν s ≠ ⊤ → μ = (↑↑μ s / ↑↑ν s) • ν",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Left invariant Borel measures on an additive measurable group are unique (up to a scalar). "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {E : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℝ E] [inst_2 : MeasurableSpace E]\n  [inst_3 : BorelSpace E] [inst_4 : FiniteDimensional ℝ E] (μ : MeasureTheory.Measure E)\n  [inst_5 : MeasureTheory.Measure.IsAddHaarMeasure μ] {s : Set E} (u : ℕ → E),\n  Metric.Bounded s →\n    Metric.Bounded (Set.range u) → Pairwise (Disjoint on fun n => {u n} + s) → MeasurableSet s → ↑↑μ s = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a set is disjoint of its translates by infinitely many bounded vectors, then it has measure\nzero. This auxiliary lemma proves this assuming additionally that the set is bounded. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {F : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup F] [inst_1 : NormedSpace ℝ F] (f : ℝ → F) [inst_2 : CompleteSpace F],\n  MeasurableSet {x | DifferentiableWithinAt ℝ f (Set.Ici x) x}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The set of right differentiability points of a function taking values in a complete space is\nBorel-measurable. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ (𝕜 : Type u_2) [inst : NontriviallyNormedField 𝕜] {E : Type u_1} [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E]\n  [inst_2 : NormedSpace 𝕜 E] {F : Type u_3} [inst_3 : NormedAddCommGroup F] [inst_4 : NormedSpace 𝕜 F] (f : E → F)\n  [inst_5 : MeasurableSpace E] [inst_6 : OpensMeasurableSpace E] [inst_7 : CompleteSpace F],\n  MeasurableSet {x | DifferentiableAt 𝕜 f x}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The set of differentiability points of a function taking values in a complete space is\nBorel-measurable. "}]

stmt: No prime number is a perfect square.
prompts:
[{"theorem": "∀ {n m : ℕ}, m * m < n → n < (m + 1) * (m + 1) → ¬∃ t, t * t = n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "There are no perfect squares strictly between m² and (m+1)² "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {F : Type u_1} [inst : Field F] [inst_1 : Finite F], ringChar F ≠ 2 → ∃ a, ¬IsSquare a",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a finite field of odd characteristic, not every element is a square. "},
 {"theorem": "Set.InjOn Nat.factorization {x | x ≠ 0}",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Every nonzero natural number has a unique prime factorization "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {m n : ℕ}, Odd n → m ∣ n → m ≠ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "`2` is not a factor of an odd natural number. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : Semiring α] {I : Ideal α} [self : Ideal.IsPrime I], I ≠ ⊤",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The prime ideal is not the entire ring. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [self : CanonicallyOrderedCommSemiring α] {a b : α}, a * b = 0 → a = 0 ∨ b = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "No zero divisors. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {p n : ℕ}, Nat.Prime p → p ∣ n → IsSquare (-1) → p % 4 ≠ 3",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a prime `p` divides `n` such that `-1` is a square modulo `n`, then `p % 4 ≠ 3`. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero α] [dec_irr : (p : Associates α) → Decidable (Irreducible p)]\n  [inst_1 : UniqueFactorizationMonoid α] [dec : DecidableEq α] [dec' : DecidableEq (Associates α)] {a p : Associates α},\n  Irreducible p →\n    ∀ [inst_2 : (n : ℕ) → Decidable (a ∣ p ^ n)] {n : ℕ} (h : a ∣ p ^ n),\n      a = p ^ Nat.find (_ : ∃ n, (fun n => a ∣ p ^ n) n)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The only divisors of prime powers are prime powers. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {a : ℕ}, Real.sqrt ↑a ≤ ↑(Nat.sqrt a) + 1",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The real square root is at most the natural square root plus one "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {n : ℕ}, 0 < n → ¬Nat.Prime n → Nat.minFac n ^ 2 ≤ n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The square of the smallest prime factor of a composite number `n` is at most `n`.\n"}]

stmt: The product of two numbers, each of which is the sum of four squares, is itself a sum of four squares.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "∀ {a b x y u v : ℕ}, a = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 → b = u ^ 2 + v ^ 2 → ∃ r s, a * b = r ^ 2 + s ^ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The set of natural numbers that are sums of two squares is closed under multiplication. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : LinearOrderedRing α] {x y : α}, x * x + y * y = 0 ↔ x = 0 ∧ y = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The sum of two squares is zero iff both elements are zero. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ (a b c d x y z w : ℕ),\n  Int.natAbs (↑a * ↑x - ↑b * ↑y - ↑c * ↑z - ↑d * ↑w) ^ 2 + Int.natAbs (↑a * ↑y + ↑b * ↑x + ↑c * ↑w - ↑d * ↑z) ^ 2 +\n        Int.natAbs (↑a * ↑z - ↑b * ↑w + ↑c * ↑x + ↑d * ↑y) ^ 2 +\n      Int.natAbs (↑a * ↑w + ↑b * ↑z - ↑c * ↑y + ↑d * ↑x) ^ 2 =\n    (a ^ 2 + b ^ 2 + c ^ 2 + d ^ 2) * (x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 + z ^ 2 + w ^ 2)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "**Euler's four-square identity**, a version for natural numbers. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {R : Type u_1} [inst : CommRing R] (a b c d x y z w : R),\n  (a * x - b * y - c * z - d * w) ^ 2 + (a * y + b * x + c * w - d * z) ^ 2 + (a * z - b * w + c * x + d * y) ^ 2 +\n      (a * w + b * z - c * y + d * x) ^ 2 =\n    (a ^ 2 + b ^ 2 + c ^ 2 + d ^ 2) * (x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 + z ^ 2 + w ^ 2)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "**Euler's four-square identity**. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ (n : ℕ), ∃ a b c d, a ^ 2 + b ^ 2 + c ^ 2 + d ^ 2 = n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "**Four squares theorem** "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {n : ℕ}, IsSquare (-1) → ∃ x y, n = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If `-1` is a square modulo the natural number `n`, then `n` is a sum of two squares. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ (R : Type u_1) [inst : CommRing R] (m k : ℕ),\n  2 * Polynomial.Chebyshev.T R m * Polynomial.Chebyshev.T R (m + k) =\n    Polynomial.Chebyshev.T R (2 * m + k) + Polynomial.Chebyshev.T R k",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The product of two Chebyshev polynomials is the sum of two other Chebyshev polynomials. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {R : Type u} [inst : Semiring R] {p q : Polynomial R},\n  p * q =\n    Finset.sum (Polynomial.support p) fun i =>\n      Polynomial.sum q fun j a => ↑(Polynomial.monomial (i + j)) (Polynomial.coeff p i * a)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Expressing the product of two polynomials as a double sum. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {m n : ℕ}, (∀ (a : ℕ), m ∣ a ↔ n ∣ a) ↔ m = n",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Two natural numbers are equal if and only if they have the same multiples. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {F : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup F] [inst_1 : InnerProductSpace ℝ F] {x y : F},\n  ‖x + y‖ = Real.sqrt (‖x‖ * ‖x‖ + ‖y‖ * ‖y‖) ↔ inner x y = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Pythagorean theorem, if-and-if vector inner product form using square roots. "}]

stmt: Every compact topological space is locally compact.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_1 : Finite α], CompactSpace α",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Finite topological spaces are compact. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_1 : LocallyCompactSpace α] (x : α), ∃ K, IsCompact K ∧ K ∈ nhds x",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a locally compact space every point has a compact neighborhood. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ (self : CompHaus), CompactSpace ↑self.toTop",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The underlying topological space is compact."},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [inst_1 : LocallyCompactSpace α] {K : Set α},\n  IsCompact K → ∃ K', IsCompact K' ∧ K ⊆ interior K'",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a locally compact space, every compact set is contained in the interior of a compact set. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} [inst : TopologicalSpace α] [self : LocallyCompactSpace α] (x : α) (n : Set α),\n  n ∈ nhds x → ∃ s, s ∈ nhds x ∧ s ⊆ n ∧ IsCompact s",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a locally compact space,\nevery neighbourhood of every point contains a compact neighbourhood of that same point. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ (H : Type u) (M : Type u_1) [inst : TopologicalSpace H] [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace M] [inst_2 : ChartedSpace H M]\n  [inst : LocallyCompactSpace H], LocallyCompactSpace M",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "If a topological space admits an atlas with locally compact charts, then the space itself\nis locally compact. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {G : Type w} [inst : TopologicalSpace G] [inst_1 : AddGroup G] [inst_2 : TopologicalAddGroup G] [inst_3 : T2Space G],\n  TopologicalSpace.PositiveCompacts G → LocallyCompactSpace G",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":

stmt: Every continuous function is uniformly continuous.

  "isProp": true,

  "∀ {α : Type u} {β : Type v} {ι : Type x} [inst : UniformSpace β] {F : ι → α → β} {f : α → β} {p : Filter ι}\n  [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace α],\n  TendstoLocallyUniformly F f p → (∀ᶠ (n : ι) in p, Continuous (F n)) → ∀ [inst_2 : Filter.NeBot p], Continuous f",

 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u} {β : Type v} [inst : UniformSpace β] {f : α → β} [inst_1 : TopologicalSpace α],\n  (∀ (x : α) (u : Set (β × β)),\n      u ∈ uniformity β → ∃ t, t ∈ nhds x ∧ ∃ F, ContinuousAt F x ∧ ∀ (y : α), y ∈ t → (f y, F y) ∈ u) →\n    Continuous f",

  "∀ {α : Type u_2} {β : Type u_1} {ι : Type u_3} {m : MeasurableSpace α} {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure α}\n  [inst : NormedAddCommGroup β] {p : ENNReal} {g : α → β},\n  1 ≤ p → p ≠ ⊤ → MeasureTheory.Memℒp g p → MeasureTheory.UniformIntegrable (fun x => g) p μ",
  "isProp": true,

 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u_1} {β : Type u_2} [inst : UniformSpace α] [inst_1 : UniformSpace β] (self : α ≃ᵤ β),\n  UniformContinuous self.toFun",

  "docString": "Uniform continuity of the function "},
 {"theorem":

stmt: The square of an even number is even.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "∀ {𝕜 : Type u𝕜} {G : Type uG} {E : Type uE} {E' : Type uE'} {F : Type uF} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup E]\n  [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E'] [inst_2 : NormedAddCommGroup F] {f : G → E} {g : G → E'} {x : G}\n  [inst_3 : NontriviallyNormedField 𝕜] [inst_4 : NormedSpace 𝕜 E] [inst_5 : NormedSpace 𝕜 E'] [inst_6 : NormedSpace 𝕜 F]\n  (L : E →L[𝕜] E' →L[𝕜] F) [inst_7 : MeasurableSpace G] {μ : MeasureTheory.Measure G} [inst_8 : NormedSpace ℝ F]\n  [inst_9 : AddCommGroup G] [inst_10 : MeasureTheory.Measure.IsAddLeftInvariant μ]\n  [inst_11 : MeasureTheory.Measure.IsNegInvariant μ] [inst_12 : MeasurableNeg G] [inst_13 : MeasurableAdd G],\n  (∀ᵐ (x : G) ∂μ, f (-x) = f x) → (∀ᵐ (x : G) ∂μ, g (-x) = g x) → convolution f g L (-x) = convolution f g L x",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The convolution of two even functions is also even. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {F : Type u_1} [inst : Field F] [inst_1 : Finite F], ringChar F = 2 → ∀ (a : F), IsSquare a",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a finite field of characteristic `2`, all elements are squares. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {a b x y u v : ℕ}, a = x ^ 2 + y ^ 2 → b = u ^ 2 + v ^ 2 → ∃ r s, a * b = r ^ 2 + s ^ 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "The set of natural numbers that are sums of two squares is closed under multiplication. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {α : Type u} [inst : LinearOrderedRing α] {x y : α}, x * x + y * y = 0 ↔ x = 0 ∧ y = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The sum of two squares is zero iff both elements are zero. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {F : Type u_1} [inst : Field F] [inst_1 : Finite F], ringChar F ≠ 2 → ∃ a, ¬IsSquare a",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "In a finite field of odd characteristic, not every element is a square. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {C : Type u_1} [inst : CategoryTheory.Category C] {W X Y Z : C} {f : W ⟶ X} {g : W ⟶ Y} {h : X ⟶ Z} {i : Y ⟶ Z},\n  CategoryTheory.CommSq f g h i → CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp f h = CategoryTheory.CategoryStruct.comp g i",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The square commutes. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {R : Type u} {S : Type v} [inst : CommRing R] [inst_1 : CommRing S] {R' : Type u_1} {S' : Type u_2}\n  [inst_2 : CommRing R'] [inst_3 : CommRing S'] {f : R →+* S} {f' : R' →+* S'} {g : R →+* R'} {g' : S →+* S'}\n  (hfg : RingHom.comp f' g = RingHom.comp g' f) (I : Ideal S'),\n  let leq := (_ : Ideal.comap f (Ideal.comap g' I) ≤ Ideal.comap g (Ideal.comap f' I));\n  RingHom.comp (Ideal.quotientMap I g' (_ : Ideal.comap g' I ≤ Ideal.comap g' I))\n      (Ideal.quotientMap (Ideal.comap g' I) f\n        (_ : Ideal.comap f (Ideal.comap g' I) ≤ Ideal.comap f (Ideal.comap g' I))) =\n    RingHom.comp (Ideal.quotientMap I f' (_ : Ideal.comap f' I ≤ Ideal.comap f' I))\n      (Ideal.quotientMap (Ideal.comap f' I) g leq)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Commutativity of a square is preserved when taking quotients by an ideal. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {p : ℕ} [inst : Fact (Nat.Prime p)], p ≠ 2 → (IsSquare 2 ↔ p % 8 = 1 ∨ p % 8 = 7)",

stmt: The numbers `3`, `4` and `5` form a Pythagorean triple.
prompts:
[{"theorem":
  "∀ {x y z : ℤ},\n  PythagoreanTriple x y z →\n    (PythagoreanTriple x y z ↔\n      ∃ k m n,\n        (x = k * (m ^ 2 - n ^ 2) ∧ y = k * (2 * m * n) ∨ x = k * (2 * m * n) ∧ y = k * (m ^ 2 - n ^ 2)) ∧\n          (z = k * (m ^ 2 + n ^ 2) ∨ z = -k * (m ^ 2 + n ^ 2)))",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "**Formula for Pythagorean Triples** "},
 {"theorem": "PythagoreanTriple 0 0 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "The zeroth Pythagorean triple is all zeros. "},
 {"theorem": "∀ {x y z : ℤ}, PythagoreanTriple x y z ↔ PythagoreanTriple y x z",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Pythagorean triples are interchangeable, i.e `x * x + y * y = y * y + x * x = z * z`.\nThis comes from additive commutativity. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {V : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup V] [inst_1 : InnerProductSpace ℝ V] (x y : V),\n  InnerProductGeometry.angle x y = Real.pi / 2 → ‖x + y‖ * ‖x + y‖ = ‖x‖ * ‖x‖ + ‖y‖ * ‖y‖",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Pythagorean theorem, vector angle form. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {𝕜 : Type u_1} {E : Type u_2} [inst : IsROrC 𝕜] [inst_1 : NormedAddCommGroup E] [inst_2 : InnerProductSpace 𝕜 E]\n  (x y : E), inner x y = 0 → ‖x + y‖ * ‖x + y‖ = ‖x‖ * ‖x‖ + ‖y‖ * ‖y‖",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Pythagorean theorem, vector inner product form. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {F : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup F] [inst_1 : InnerProductSpace ℝ F] {x y : F},\n  ‖x + y‖ = Real.sqrt (‖x‖ * ‖x‖ + ‖y‖ * ‖y‖) ↔ inner x y = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Pythagorean theorem, if-and-if vector inner product form using square roots. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {V : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup V] [inst_1 : InnerProductSpace ℝ V] (x y : V),\n  ‖x + y‖ * ‖x + y‖ = ‖x‖ * ‖x‖ + ‖y‖ * ‖y‖ ↔ InnerProductGeometry.angle x y = Real.pi / 2",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Pythagorean theorem, if-and-only-if vector angle form. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {V : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup V] [inst_1 : InnerProductSpace ℝ V] (x y : V),\n  InnerProductGeometry.angle x y = Real.pi / 2 → ‖x - y‖ * ‖x - y‖ = ‖x‖ * ‖x‖ + ‖y‖ * ‖y‖",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString": "Pythagorean theorem, subtracting vectors, vector angle form. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {F : Type u_1} [inst : NormedAddCommGroup F] [inst_1 : InnerProductSpace ℝ F] (x y : F),\n  ‖x + y‖ * ‖x + y‖ = ‖x‖ * ‖x‖ + ‖y‖ * ‖y‖ ↔ inner x y = 0",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "Pythagorean theorem, if-and-only-if vector inner product form. "},
 {"theorem":
  "∀ {x y z : ℤ} (k : ℤ), k ≠ 0 → (PythagoreanTriple (k * x) (k * y) (k * z) ↔ PythagoreanTriple x y z)",
  "isProp": true,
  "docString":
  "`(k*x, k*y, k*z)` is a Pythagorean triple if and only if\n`(x, y, z)` is also a triple. "}]
